summary: This bill, HR 1352, proposes to designate the General George C. Marshall House in Virginia as an affiliated area of the National Park System. The bill outlines the establishment, description, and management of the site, including the role of the George C. Marshall International Center as the management entity. It allows for cooperative agreements with the Secretary of the Interior for assistance in marketing, interpretation, and preservation, but specifies the Secretary will not acquire property or assume financial responsibility. The bill also protects private property rights and restricts the creation of buffer zones around the site.
